pageContext.claim: “Finally, Mainstream Media is getting involved - too ‘hot’ to avoid. Pulitzer Prize anyone? The New York Times, on front page (finally), ‘Details effort to spy on Trump Campaign.’ @foxandfriends  This is bigger than WATERGATE, but the reverse!”
pageContext.analysis: "Spying" is a loaded word and there's no evidence that the FBI's investigation of Trump's campaign and its contacts with Russia violated any legal limits, though the Justice Department's inspector general is conducting an inquiry. The Times reported that the FBI sent an investigator posing as a research assistant to London to ask then-campaign adviser George Papadopoulos whether the Trump campaign had ties to Russia. The FBI had opened a counterintelligence investigation based on Papadopoulos's claims to an Australian diplomat, as had long been known before the Times's story.
